title: Ticket #928: Condor "Snow Leopard" Release
description:
Want to have a Condor release party at your home?

  • Kill standard universe
    • DMTCP. (#1000)
    • Update Chirp / Investigate CCTools.

  • New ClassAds.

  • Async Negotiation.

  • Log Standardization. This means common functionality for headers, rotation, and/or locking, and/or consolidation.

  • Continue HDFS. HAD replication.

  • Source/Build/Test Overhaul
    • cmake #779
    • run test suite as root
    • more tests running on Windows
    • more tests
    • support parallel testing, general test cleanup
    • new windows installer?
    • library overhaul (libcondor.BIGGIE)
    • only ship dynamic binaries
    • make --without-suck the default for build suite. That is, builds should Just Work, even on non-AFS, non-CSL supported machines.
    • Improve manual build process
    • On Win32, compile up perl files to .exe
    • Open up condor-wiki and git repo (#1045)
    • More developer documentation: e.g. document negotation protocols, claiming protos, blah, blah
    • Auto detection of circular dependencies.

  • Data Improvements
    • File Plugin writing, file plugin support for SPOOL.

  • PURGE
    • GCB
    • Standard Univ
    • Stork
    • NeST (#996)
    • Oracle code (#987)
    • Quill code (saved as a plugin?)
    • All documented code cruft: CodeCruft
    • All code for ancient platforms, incl Windows 2000
    • All backwards compatibility code that predates 7.0. See #953
    • Old/dead param knobs and related code
    • PVM
    • Kill any universe that can be represented as toppings (java? )
    • Kill backfill - represent it as work-fetch, see HowToConfigureBackfill

  • Refactor?
    • startd duplicate classes
    • unify signal sending codes, especially in startd.
    • make procd daemonCore
    • Ticket #883: VM universe refactor
    • Rename all functions which conflict with standard lib.
    • Cleanup binding deps in daemon core which result in bloat and world linkage #1057

  • Ease of Use
    • Auto upgrade.
    • Finish param coding work. #123 #988
    • Incorporate wisdom for new param defaults. #767
    • Wizard or cookbook for common configurations.
    • Quick-start Guide
    • More tuning knobs that are automatically set.
    • Log per job, aka syslog or some sort of log routing.
    • IDs per log entry
    • dprintf taking a subsystem AND a severity (3 at most: debug, warning, error). [I have specific ideas on this. --psilord]
    • More "background" in the manual, less of a reference manual. O'Rielley book, baabbbyy!
    • Improve better analyze
    • Improve installation: especially a secure by default configuration, and execute node priv-sep by default.
    • Named slots? a condor_config_lint ?
    • Leverage the mini web server.
    • Replace condor view w/ something better that knows groups, aka no more need for a cron job and a perl script to get group usage reports.
    • make condor_version emit much more kinds of configure-time detected information, like if stack protector was used, what features are/aren't available, etc.

  • Improve three Festivus Themes (Some of which are mentioned here)
    • condor more open (#1045)
    • clean up tests (#1124)
    • strike: better traceability and accountability in tickets (See matts reports).

  • Little changes to defaults
    • Startd sends updates should be the default.
    • Threading in collector by default????
    • Some green computing stuff by default?????
    • Make dynamic slots work better w/ the parallel universe, #986

  • Performance, Scalability Improvements
    • Schedd Improvements (#1284)
      • Children born w/ a security session to parent.
    • Performance metrics gathered by Condor itself, or at least test suite.
    • ClassAd lazy eval and caching of expressions. Constant folding, for the love of mankind???

  • Packaging
    • Knock it off.

  • VM Universe (#523)
